REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_coming_birthday(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None¶

Retrieves contacts with birthdays coming up in the next 7 days for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays, or None if no contacts found.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → str | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

str | None

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, query: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact] | None¶

Searches for contacts for a specific user based on a query string.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of notes to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of notes to return.

  • query (str) – The search query string. Contacts are searchable by first name, last name, or email address.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → str | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

str | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Marks the user’s email as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user in the database with optional avatar.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data model containing user information.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created User object.

Return type:

User

This function attempts to fetch a image for the user’s email. If successful, it sets this as the user’s avatar. If unsuccessful, it prints the error and proceeds without an avatar.

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Retrieves a user from the database by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to find.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The User object if found, or None if no user with the given email exists.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user identified by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar needs to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated User object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a given user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose token needs to be updated.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token. Can be a string or None to remove the token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

This function updates the refresh_token field of the user and commits the change to the database. If token is None, it effectively removes the refresh token for the user.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.coming_birthdays(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponce]

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact details.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponce

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The requested contact if found else exception.

Return type:

ContactResponce or HTTPException

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponce]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Remove a contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to remove.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The removed contact if found else exception.

Return type:

ContactResponce or HTTPException

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, query: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • query (str) – Search query string.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponce]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update an existing contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Updated contact details.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The updated contact if found else exception.

Return type:

ContactResponce or HTTPException

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The current user’s information.

Return type:

User

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the avatar of the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to be uploaded as the new avatar.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The updated user information including the new avatar URL.

Return type:

User

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm user’s email using a token. :param token: The confirmation token sent to the user’s email. :type token: str :param db: Database session. :type db: Session :return: A dictionary with a message indicating the result of the email confirmation process. If user confirmed or not exist it returns exception. :rtype: dict or HTTPException

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The OAuth2 password request form containing username and password.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

If authentication is successful, a dictionary containing access token, refresh token, and token type. If the email is invalid, not confirmed, or the password is incorrect, exception.

Return type:

dict or HTTPException

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP Authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing new access token, refresh token, and token type if successful. If the refresh token is invalid, it raises an exception.

Return type:

dict or HTTPException

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Object for adding background tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI request object.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message indicating the result of the email confirmation request.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User data for registration.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Object for adding background tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI request object.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

If registration is successful, a dictionary containing information about the created user and a success message. If a user with the given email already exists, exception.

Return type:

dict or HTTPException
